course.title: Society and the Witch
course.description: Witches are often imagined to be outside society. But this socially marginal figure may provide a key to understanding social norms, norms that get articulated through the witch's very violation of them. In this course, we ask what discourses about witches tell us about the societies that produce them. We'll examine enduring fascinations with the occult in modernity, a period when magic was supposed to disappear. We'll explore topics ranging from self-identified magicians to the sensationally successful Harry Potter series. Readings draw from anthropology, folklore and mythology, gender studies, history, literature, and popular culture.
